intro: Aldama grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered aldama, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It produces small, follicle-like fruits that contain the seeds. Aldama grandiflora is often found in dry, rocky areas and is adapted to arid environments.
